thread.title: Oktoberfest lets beer flow
thread.title_full: Oktoberfest lets beer flow - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Rob Krieger, Reporter
title: Oktoberfest lets beer flow
text:
KENNER, LA (WVUE) - Oktoberfest kicks off with a bang as the traditional German celebration lets the beer flow for thousands.
Deutsches Haus, the home for German culture on the Gulf Coast, hosts the annual event, something they’ve been doing since they founded their home in New Orleans back in the 1920’s.
The celebration is the organization’s biggest fundraiser and this year it will help raise money to build a new “Haus” for the group.
“We need support to return home to New Orleans at 1700 Moss Street,” Theresa Crosby, the Executive Director of Deutsches Haus said. “We can't wait to be on the Bayou and have Oktoberfest there, in the meantime, the city of Kenner has been a gracious host, but we want to get back home to New Orleans.”
The event is held at Kenner’s River Town over the next three weekends and will feature multiple German beers, and traditional German food, including schnitzel, pretzels, and bratwurst.
“We'll probably feed over 2,000 tonight and tomorrow probably about 3,000. We estimate over the three weekends we’ll have about 15,000 people coming to enjoy it,” Crosby said.
The festival costs $6 for adults and children under 12 get in free. It runs every Friday and Saturday for the next three weekends at River Town in Kenner.
